sentence.text: He was described by one of his students as being ` a brilliant man but so practically inept that he needed help to cross the road safely " .
Do these experts really think that mothers are so inept that they would go on doing something that is so ineffective ? "
There has been some fairly loose and wide-ranging sniping about inept leadership ( Carrick ) and incompetence ( the committee ) .
Never much of an orator , Mr Kohl has not sounded convincing in his calls for solidarity with the Gulf allies ; and his reaction to Soviet bullying in the Baltic has been inept .
Though banks have proved inept at merging , big ones in the same market should be able to achieve 30% cost savings .
The winner came in the 64th minute thanks to a combination of fine attacking play from Jason Soloman and inept defending by Boro .
It is socially very inept to ask someone their age and , if they tell you , it is often in an embarrassed whisper .
If you were so evidently inept , why did the company see fit to give you the job in the first place ?
Throughout the '80s he had been a tower of strength as the last line in defence and had single-handedly reversed the image of the inept Scottish keeper .
Inept leadership and disastrous hesitations had brought them to this .
Often , the people most committed to the use of charismatic gifts are those most inept in evangelism .
Very sincere and always willing to help a human , dobies are nonetheless inept at most tasks .
She believes it would be politically inept to cut such training programmes at a time when the jobless total is rising fast and will soon top three million .
Paul Ride is paying for our Prime Minister 's inept penny-pinching .
Inept handling of the match by the referee ensured that the game would not pass without incident .
Preparations for the landings were mostly inept and inadequate .
Italian government is famously inept , its parties -- not only the Christian Democrats -- infamously corrupt .
There were flings , of course , but Nicholas was inept at all forms of promiscuity except gossip .
` I 'm giving a dinner party , " said Elizabeth to Lydia with the odd composure of those who are conversationally inept and unaware of it .
She had somehow found it difficult to defend Brian against the accusations of his first wife , who held that he was inept and ineffectual in the field of human relationships .
There was the added disadvantage that he was irresponsible and financially inept .
Hon. Members can imagine how inept the Government must be to believe that overlooking a prison yard , floodlit day and night , would be conducive to the recuperation of neurosurgical patients .
Part of the oddness of her appearance , he realized , came from the fact that she did n't look like a woman so much as a rather inept female impersonator .
ARDS manager Paul Malone was n't in the least bit perturbed at his side 's inept display at Newry .
